title: Equestria.dev: Software platform you can rely on

legal.trademark: "Equestria.dev" and associated names are trademarks of Equestria.dev Developers in France and other countries. The Equestria.dev and projects logos are protected under applicable copyright laws. JetBrains, the associated logos and the associated names are registered trademarks of JetBrains s.r.o., used under license.

dev.title: Development
dev.description: With over 5 years of experience in software development, in a wide range of languages — such as Rust, JavaScript, Kotlin or PHP —, you can be rest assured that we will develop quality software to help fulfill your needs, whether you are a business or an individual.

network.title: Networking
network.description: Did you know this text went through at least 3 different Equestria.dev servers before reaching you? With our years of experience in managing servers — mainly Linux —, we can fully optimize any application to perform at its best regardless of the server load.

privacy.title: Privacy
privacy.description: Privacy, security and protecting user data has always been one of our core values. Whenever possible — and needed —, we use robust military-grade encryption technology, and we make sure user data is always safe and protected from various types of attacks.

contact.title: Have a special request?
contact.description: If you would like us to help with a project of your own, whether it is regarding development, managing servers or privacy and security, we can help. Feel free to drop us a message and we will see what we can do.

descriptions.404: If you followed a link from this website, then something must be wrong. If you followed an external link, then it is possible that link is incorrect and needs to be updated. If you entered the address yourself, it is possible you misspelled something.
descriptions.403: You have tried to reach a page that is not accessible from this website. This is usually the case for internal files that are used on the server. If you followed a link from this website and got here, then something must be wrong.
descriptions.401: You have tried to reach a page that requires authentication without being authenticated. Refreshing the page usually helps fix this issue. If you don't have credentials to authenticate for this page, you can go back to the home page.
descriptions.400: You have tried to send a request to the server that it cannot process. This should generally not happen, but it might indicate an issue with your browser. If you need help to fix this, feel free to contact us.
descriptions.500: An error occurred on the server while trying to process your request that is unrelated to your browser configuration. This is generally a bug or a temporary issue. If it persists, you can let us know about the issue so we can fix it.
descriptions.501: The page you have tried to reach uses a server feature that has not been implemented in the website yet. This is usually because the page you are trying to reach is a work in progress and will be available in the future.
descriptions.502: This page depends on an external resource or server that is not available at this time. This typically indicates an outage on one or more of our servers. If the issue persists, contact us so we can fix this.
descriptions.503: This page depends on an internal resource that is not available at this time. This typically means that the resource, website or server is under maintenance and is currently unavailable. Check our status page for more information.
descriptions.504: This page depends on an external resource or server that was not able to be reached on time. This typically indicates an outage or an overall slow-down. If the issue persists, contact us so we can fix this.
descriptions.default: An undocumented error occurred. We are not sure what went wrong, but the error code can help you. If you need help, please get in touch with us so we can fix this. We sincerely apologize for the inconvenience.

actions.home: Go back to the home page

status.title: Systems status
main: All the services are operating as nominal
Some services are experiencing performance degradation
Some services are experiencing a major outage
description: We have observed nominal and good performance of all the services hosted by Equestria.dev at the moment.
We have observed that some Equestria.dev services, while being functional, are being slower than usual.
We have observed down time in some Equestria.dev services, making them innacessible for some time.
affected: The following service is affected by this incident:
The following services are affected by this incident:

notices.title: Legal disclaimers
notices.privacy: If you ever need more details, please contact us directly. Some information is kept hidden for privacy reasons.
webmasters: Unless in presence of user-created content, the content hosted on Equestria.dev's platform is under the responsibility of

Even though we make as much effort as possible into providing users with accurate information, the Equestria.dev developers cannot guarantee the preciseness of the information provided by our platforms. Therefore, the information on our platforms may be inexact or outdated.
notices.locations: Equestria.dev manages networks transiting user data in France, Germany and the United States. Networks that are only used for Equestria.dev's internal purposes and that do not transit user data are not mentioned on this page.
notices.howto: Should any Equestria.dev user request access or deletion of user data, an email containing the IP address of the user, any device identifiers (if applicable), an Equestria.dev account ID (if applicable) needs to be sent from the email address associated with the Equestria.dev account (if applicable) to the following email address:
notices.law: As per law enforcement rules, Equestria.dev is unable to delete server logs that are less than 3 months old.
notices.pgp: This is a PGP message signed with the following key:
notices.plain: View warrant canary (opens in a new tab)

branding.title: Equestria.dev branding guidelines
branding.intro: At Equestria.dev, we take things and how you represent our brand seriously. The Equestria.dev brand should represent quality, simple and private open-source software. If you use our branding assets for anything, please make sure to respect these guidelines.
branding.copyright: The Equestria.dev logo and products are protected by applicable copyright laws in France, the United States, and other countries. Equestria.dev grants you a non-transferable, non-exclusive, royalty-free limited license to use its logo as defined by the following guidelines. These guidelines also regulate use of the Equestria.dev logo throughout our own services. Failure to abide is considered an infringement on Equestria.dev's intellectual property and will lead to legal action.

logo.title: Our logo
logo.message: Please do not edit, change, distort, recolor, or reconfigure the Equestria.dev logo.

icon.title: Icon only
icon.message: Use these only when the Equestria.dev brand is clearly visible, has been well established elsewhere on the page or in the design, or space does not permit showing the full version. When in doubt, use the other one.

spacing.title: Spacing
spacing.message: Make sure to respect these spacing guidelines while using the Equestria.dev logo. Additionally, make sure you make the logo big enough to be legible and distinguishable.
spacing.notice: (the icon only version is recommended in spaces where you have to show the logo at sizes less than 96 pixels or 52.8 millimeters, down to 24 pixels or 13.2 millimeters)

dont.title: Don'ts
messages: Do not edit, change or reconfigure the logo or the wordmark
Do not distort the logo or the wordmark including unintentionally
Do not recolor or apply visual effects to the logo or the wordmark
Do not place a tagline or any other element over the logo or wordmark
descriptions: This includes not rotating the logo and changing any text or shape, along with maintaining spacing between the different elements of the full logo.
You must not distort or deform the logo in any way, whether it is in a 2D or 3D frame. Additionally, make sure the logo is displayed properly in all cases.
Both the logo and wordmark must be kept as is, with no color change at all. If you need to use grayscale, use the monochrome variants.
Ensure that the taglines (if applicable) never overlap any element of the logo. Additionally, do not endorse approval or sponsorship when there is none.

too.title: Don't do too much
text: Ensure that the Equestria.dev brand is not displayed more prominently than the name, logo or brand of your own product or service.
Doing "too much" could lead to confusion and make users think they are facing either the official Equestria.dev website, or an official Equestria.dev product.

attribution.title: Don't use without attribution
attribution.message: When using the Equestria.dev logo or any project logo, always give attribution with either of the following texts:

impersonation.title: Don't imitate or impersonate
text: Mimicking the Equestria.dev brand in non-Equestria.dev materials is not allowed. The same restriction applies for animating the Equestria.dev brand, combining it with any other words, symbols, images, or designs, or incorporating it into a slogan or tagline.
Additionally, using the name or likeness of an individual from within Equestria.dev or the group as whole in any social media account or other media is strictly prohibited.

endorsement.title: Don't imply endorsement where there is none
text: We value collaboration, however, do not in any way imply affiliation, sponsorship, endorsement or approval of your products or services with Equestria.dev without Equestria.dev's express permission. You need to have a cooperation formally established in writing with an agreement from Equestria.dev before referring to such cooperation with Equestria.dev.
This means text such as "Approved by Equestria.dev", "Equestria.dev Certified" or "Recommended by Equestria.dev" is not allowed.

color.title: Color palette
color.intro: The Equestria.dev color palette, named "Brightdawn" (after Misty Brightdawn, the character from My Little Pony) has been created to reflect our core values: inclusiveness, friendship and transparency. It is based on the original "Misty" palette used in 2023 updated to include brighter colors.

more.title: Looking for more?
more.text: Download the full Equestria.dev brand kit and get access to all the resources we used to create our logo, along with special variants used in specific conditions, including prototype designs and other design sheets.
